initiativeCore.problemStatement: Parents need a simple, zero-infrastructure baby monitoring solution that works entirely in the browser without requiring server setup, app installation, or keeping the browser tab in focus, enabling real-time video streaming and cry detection notifications between devices.
goals: Enable peer-to-peer video streaming between browser instances without server infrastructure
Detect baby crying and send browser notifications when the monitoring tab is open but not in focus
Deliver the entire application as a single self-contained HTML file requiring no installation
Support dual-mode operation where any instance can act as camera (sender) or viewer (receiver)
nonGoals: Cloud recording or storage of video streams
Multi-room monitoring with multiple camera sources
initiativeCore.businessImpact: Success enables parents to repurpose existing devices as baby monitors without purchasing dedicated hardware or subscribing to cloud services, reducing barrier to entry. Failure results in continued reliance on expensive dedicated baby monitors or inadequate smartphone solutions requiring constant screen attention.
initiativeCore.stakeholders: Parents with infants/toddlers, caregivers, technical users comfortable with browser-based tools

functional.description: Application must be deliverable as a single HTML file with all dependencies embedded (CSS, JavaScript, assets)
Establish peer-to-peer WebRTC connection between two browser instances without signaling server
Capture video and audio from device camera/microphone in sender mode
Stream captured media to connected peer in real-time with acceptable latency (<3 seconds)
Detect crying sounds from audio stream using client-side audio analysis
Send browser notifications when crying is detected, even when tab is not in focus
Allow user to toggle between sender (camera) and viewer (monitor) modes within the same application
Display received video stream in viewer mode with audio playback
Provide connection status indicators (connected, disconnected, connecting)
Enable manual connection establishment via shared connection code or QR code
Allow adjustment of cry detection sensitivity threshold
Provide visual indicator when crying is detected on sender side

nonFunctional.description: Application must function entirely offline after initial HTML file load (no external CDN dependencies)
Support modern browsers with WebRTC support (Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 14+, Edge 80+)
HTML file size must remain under 5MB for easy sharing via email/messaging
Video streaming latency must not exceed 3 seconds under normal network conditions
Cry detection must have <10% false positive rate and <20% false negative rate
Application must request and handle camera/microphone permissions gracefully
Browser notifications must work when tab is backgrounded but browser is open
Connection must automatically recover from temporary network interruptions within 30 seconds
UI must be responsive and usable on laptop/desktop screens (minimum 1024x768)
Application must handle graceful degradation when WebRTC is not supported

edgeCases: User closes browser tab while monitoring - notifications stop, connection drops
Both peers attempt to initiate connection simultaneously
Network switches between WiFi and cellular during active session
Camera/microphone permissions denied or revoked mid-session
Multiple tabs of the application open in same browser
Browser enters sleep/power-saving mode on laptop
Firewall or NAT configuration prevents WebRTC connection establishment
Audio input contains non-crying loud noises (TV, music, other children)
Baby makes crying-like sounds while awake and playing
Browser tab crashes or becomes unresponsive during monitoring
Extremely poor network conditions cause continuous reconnection loops
User attempts to connect sender to multiple viewers simultaneously
Device runs out of storage while buffering media streams

criteria.description: User can open single HTML file in browser without internet connection and application loads successfully
User can establish peer-to-peer connection between two browser instances on different devices using connection code
Video stream from sender appears in viewer within 3 seconds of connection establishment
Browser notification appears within 5 seconds when crying sound is detected, even when viewer tab is backgrounded
User can switch between sender and viewer modes without reloading the page
Application correctly requests camera and microphone permissions when entering sender mode
Connection status indicator updates correctly during connect/disconnect/reconnect cycles
Cry detection triggers notification for recorded baby crying samples with >80% accuracy
Application displays helpful error message when WebRTC is not supported by browser
HTML file size remains under 5MB when all assets are embedded
Connection automatically re-establishes within 30 seconds after temporary network interruption
User can adjust cry detection sensitivity and changes take effect immediately
Application provides intuitive user experience for non-technical parents

measurableOutcomes: 95% of connection attempts succeed within 10 seconds on standard home networks
Cry detection achieves <10% false positive rate and <20% false negative rate in testing
Application loads and becomes interactive within 2 seconds on modern laptops
Video streaming maintains <3 second latency in 90% of sessions
Zero external network requests after initial HTML file load

internalDependencies: WebRTC implementation and browser API compatibility
Audio analysis algorithm for cry detection
Peer connection signaling mechanism without server
Media stream capture and encoding logic

externalDependencies.name: Web Audio API for cry detection
Browser support for background tab notifications

factors: No defined goals, non-goals, or stakeholder list in original brief
Missing acceptance criteria and success metrics
No timeline, budget, or resource constraints specified
No explicit dependencies or technical constraints documented
Serverless peer-to-peer WebRTC without signaling server is technically complex
Cry detection algorithm accuracy requirements undefined
Browser compatibility and permission handling not specified
Single HTML file constraint may limit functionality and maintainability
mitigations: Define explicit success metrics for cry detection accuracy
Prototype WebRTC connection establishment without signaling server early
Test across target browsers and document compatibility matrix
Implement fallback mechanisms for failed peer connections
Create test suite with real baby crying audio samples
Document network requirements and troubleshooting guide for users
Consider STUN server usage for NAT traversal while maintaining no-server goal
Establish file size budget and asset optimization strategy
Define minimum viable feature set for initial release

deliveryIntent.rolloutExpectations: Single HTML file distributed directly to users via file sharing, email, or download link. No deployment infrastructure required. Users self-host by opening file in browser.
deliveryIntent.timelineAssumptions: Timeline not specified. Assumes iterative development with early prototype for WebRTC connection validation, followed by cry detection integration, then UI polish.
constraints: Must be single self-contained HTML file with no external dependencies
Cannot use server infrastructure for signaling or relay
Must work with browser tab backgrounded but not closed
Limited to browser capabilities and APIs available in modern browsers
File size constrained by practical sharing limits (email attachments, messaging apps)
